text.p: These are the leading stories in the Beirut press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-Egyptian President Mubarak said: "There will be no war in Lebanon or against Syria, but if the peace process with Israel collapses we will see what is worse than war."
-Prime Minister Hariri said: "Israel will not aggress against Lebanon because such a war is internationally unacceptable".
-Opposition MP Wakim accused Hariri and other top officials of profiteering from a new media law and asked judicial authorities to prosecute them.
-Israeli Defence Minister Mordechai visited the Israeli occupation zone in south Lebanon and said: "The Israeli army will come up with a suitable response to the deteriorating situation in the area".
-Foreign Minister Bouez and UNICEF signed a $17.5 million agreement under which the U.N. agency will provide health, education and basic social services to children in Lebanon for five years.
-A masked gunman killed a former member of a radical Palestinian guerrilla group in a south Lebanon refugee camp.
-Pro-Iranian Hizbollah secretary general Nasrallah said: Israel is increasing tension in the south because it wants to amend the April 26 ceasefire understanding.
-A pro-Israeli militiaman was wounded when Hizbollah guerrillas set off a bomb near his patrol in south Lebanon.
